text.div:
SampledData Logical Model

Data that comes from a series of measurements taken by a device, which may have upper and lower limits. The data type also supports more than one dimension in the data.

name: SampledData
title: shr-core-SampledData
description: Data that comes from a series of measurements taken by a device, which may have upper and lower limits. The data type also supports more than one dimension in the data.

element.definition: Data that comes from a series of measurements taken by a device, which may have upper and lower limits. The data type also supports more than one dimension in the data.

element.short: Data represented as a text sting.
element.definition: Data represented as a text sting.

element.short: The shr.base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.
element.definition: The shr.base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

element.short: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.
element.definition: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.

element.short: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.
element.definition: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.

element.short: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'L' (lower than detection limit).
element.definition: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'L' (lower than detection limit).

element.short: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'U' (higher than detection limit).
element.definition: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'U' (higher than detection limit).

element.short: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.
element.definition: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.
